text:
reposting :bulb::
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Editable-module-IDs-for-drag-and-drop-templates/idc-p/297010>
I would love the ability to have editable module IDs ( I mean, the referal/unique module names like module_XXXXXXX that you can use to access the data like all_widgets.module_XXXXXX). It could be an editable field like the module alias or classes.  There it would have much more sense and will give us the ability to use easier and logical names for easy access.

It will solve for example issues when you need to swap the module for a different one, and will save some sanity!
Give me some kudos bois!
 To the moon!:rocket:

Would be really nice to have a "developer view" option when developing custom modules. Right now if we want to see a JSON view, we need to put the module that's still being developed into a page template and look at it from there.
can you elaborate on what you’d want to see in this developer view? are you thinking like, everything you’d see in developer info for that module?
he’s specifically talking about block syntax I think.

yeah, like for example one of my team members this morning was working on a module that used a recent posts function, and he wanted to see all the object props returned from that function. Typically that would be shown in the developer JSON view, but because that's not an option, he could either |pprint and cmd+f through the poor formatting, or put the draft module in a template then look at that page's JSON view.

Please allow us to hide locked modules in the content editor.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Hide-locked-modules-in-content-editor/idi-p/297258#M43792>
